info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 04 at 5:29PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Warren County through 600 PM EDT... At 529 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles west of Johnsburg, or 13 miles east of Speculator, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Warrensburg, Johnsburg, Chestertown, North Creek, Bolton Landing, Bolton, Thurman, Thurman Station, Cleverdale, Sodom, Starbuckville, Edwards Hill, Wevertown, Holcombville, South Horicon, Athol, Riverbank, Rockhurst, North Bolton and Darrowsville. This includes Interstate 87 between exits 23 and 25. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for eastern and east central New York.
